summary: This document is a chain of emails from April 2019 among staff at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) arranging travel to Florida for meetings and interviews with witnesses in the case 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618', an investigation relating to the enticement of minors for sexual activity. It details flight bookings, hotel reservations, and conference room arrangements for prosecutors.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.context: Legal assistant in the Public Corruption unit who is coordinating travel arrangements, including booking flights, hotel, and a conference room for the prosecutors' trip to Florida.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Prosecutor traveling to West Palm Beach, Florida, for meetings and interviews with witnesses in the Epstein case; makes specific travel requests.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: SDNY staff member who provides travel policy guidance and is copied on travel approval requests.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: SDNY official who approves travel requests for the Epstein case investigation.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Prosecutor traveling with 'Alex' to Florida for witness meetings in the Epstein case; mentioned in travel coordination.

connections.description: Co-prosecutors traveling together to Florida for witness interviews in the Epstein case.
Prosecutor (Alex) requests travel arrangements from legal assistant (Alleyne).
Tyrrell approves travel requests submitted by Alex for the Epstein investigation.
SDNY staff members coordinating on travel procedures and notifications.

events.title: SDNY Prosecutors' Travel to Florida for Witness Meetings
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorneys Alex and Alison travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, to conduct meetings and interviews with witnesses in the Epstein case. They book a conference room at the Hyatt Place for these meetings.

events.title: Travel Approval Request for Epstein Case
events.description: Alex requests and receives approval from Edward Tyrrell to travel to Florida for approximately three days for the Epstein investigation, citing the case as 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618, an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.

events.title: Initial Travel Approval Request
events.description: An earlier travel request is made by Alex for a two-day trip to West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale for meetings and interviews related to the Epstein case.

locations: Hyatt Place West Palm Beach Downtown (hotel)
keyFacts: The document confirms active investigation and witness interviews by the SDNY in the Epstein case ('United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618') as of April 2019, specifically for 'enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
Prosecutors from the SDNY traveled to West Palm Beach, Florida, booking a hotel conference room for meetings with witnesses, indicating coordinated, in-person investigative work.
The email chain reveals internal DOJ travel approval and coordination procedures for the high-profile investigation.
The travel was approved by Edward Tyrrell, indicating supervisory oversight within the U.S. Attorney's Office.
The document is part of a series (EFTA00081389, EFTA00081390, EFTA00081391) showing sequential planning and authorization.
